result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah M. Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 16CM109, 15CM206, 15CM251, 15CM347 called together at 10:49am
Defendant Noah M. Sanders in court, in custody with Attorney Jeremy Christopher Evans.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Sanders

As to Case 15CM206:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90  days in Jefferson County Jail, this sentence is to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System as Mr. Sanders in currently serving a Prison sentence
--the court orders all costs and fees be converted to civil judgement; to include $66 in subpoena fees incurred by the State
--0 days credit for time already served given


As to Case 15CM251:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--On Count #1: to serve 6 months in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM206
--On Count #2: to serve 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM206 and Count #1
--On Count #3: to serve 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being 
--On Count #4: to serve 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being 
--all to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System as Mr. Sanders in currently serving a prison sentence 
--the court orders all costs and fees be converted to civil judgement; to include $73 in subpoena fees incurred by the State
--0 days credit for time already served given

As to Case 15CM347:
--On Count #1: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--On Count #2: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--On Count #3: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--On Count #4: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--On Count #5: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--all to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System as Mr. Sanders in currently serving a prison sentence 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--the court orders all costs and fees be converted to civil judgement


Upon inquiry of the Clerk, the Court indicates that all these sentences are to be served without Huber privilege
The Court finds that Mr. Sanders has previously submitted a DNA sample.

recess: 11:52am
Sentencing hearing on April 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
with Elements attached
Criminal Case Settlement

factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

to Amend Criminal Complaint - State's
Letter from Attorney Evans ref scheduling
and Transport the Defendant from Fox Lake Correctional for proceedings in Branch 3 on 3-4-16
Proposed Order to Produece the Defendant from Fox Lake Correctional for the 3/4/16 Hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-04-2016 11:00 am

Cases 15CM206, 15CM251 & 15CM347 called together at 11:21 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Noah M. Sanders in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeremy Christopher Evans. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
15CM251 - Atty Evans informs the Court that they are not on track for trial. Requests all matters be set for plea/sentencing date. Close to resolution, however do require more time to review discovery particularly the audio/visual discovery. Mr. Sanders was recently transferred to Fox Lake so has been difficult to meet with him. Felony matter in BrIV has been set for plea/sentencing on 2/25/16, request all matters be set out around that date. 
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Evans indicates that the audio/visual needs are in case 15CM251 & 15CM347
Court admonishes Atty Evans re: not being prepared for trial - informs Atty Evans that Mr. Sanders can either enter a plea or go to trial
Atty Evans requests a moment to confer with client, Recess: 11:29 am Reconvene: 11:51 am ADA Brookellen Teuber now appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Evans informs the Court that Mr. Sanders could proceed with pleas today
ADA Brookellen Teuber informs the Court that she is assigned to Mr. Sander's cases. Case 15CM206 will be dismissed, could take a plea on 15CM251 alone with
sentencing on a later date. Submits victim impact statement
Atty Evans informs the Court that they will proceed to resolve 15CM251, requests moment to complete paperwork & confer with State 
Recess: 11:57 am Reconvene: 12:16 pm [Court Reporter: Erica Schueler] 
Court informs parties that in reviewing the complaint in case 15CM251, indicates that there are significant audio tapes of jail calls
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Evans indicates that he has not yet reviewed tapes in 15CM251 with Mr. Sanders
Court reconsiders and grants the defense request for adjournment; Court removes trial in case 15CM251
ADA Teuber indicates that all matters should be reset for plea/sentencing
Court informs parties that someone who can commit their calendar shall contact the Court's JA no later than 2/5/16 by 4:00 pm to schedule plea/sentencing or all matters for trial
Recess: 12:23 pm 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing Hearing - Send notices **Counsel to contact the Court's JA** (2/25/15 at 8:30 am or the 24th anytime per Defense request or the 24th anytime)

In response to Stipulation and Order for Continuance the Court orders: the hearing set for 2/1/16 at 11am will be converted to a status conference. The defendant will be brought on a writ that Attorney Evans will prepare.
Defendant from Fox Lake Correctional for the 2/1/16 Hearing

[MK] cases #15CM251 and #15CM206 called at 2:23pm. 
Defendant Noah M. Sanders appears via videoconferencing from the Dodge County Jail, in custody. His counsel, Attorney Karl Huebner appears in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearance conducted in Case #15CM251:
--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
--Pleas of "not guilty" entered.

As to both cases:   
--The Court grants the State's oral Motion for an Order prohibiting Mr. Sanders from having contact with Kelly Lueck under Statute 940.47, and enforceable by the Court's contempt powers.
--Attorney Hubener indicates that the Defense is requesting speedy trial in both cases.
recess 2:30pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on both cases on 9/9/15 at 10:20am,  (2) In case #15CM206: FSSC on 9/28/15 at 11:00am and Jury Trial on 10/1 or 10/2/15 at 8:30am,  (3) In case #15CM251: FSSC on 10/5/15 at 11:00am and Jury Trial on 10/8/15 at 8:30am.

Cases 15CM206 and 15CM251 called together at 9:53am [mo]
Defendant Noah M. Sanders in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

On Defendant's 7/23/15 Letter to Court regarding Counsel:
--Atty. Svehlek verifies receipt of letter
--Mr. Sander's indicates that it is still his request to have different counsel
--Atty. Svehlek summarizes case history, indicates that she has been effective and timely
--Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Sander's is able to obtain subsequent counsel through the PD office, requests that case 15CM251 be set over until new counsel is appointed. 

The Court finds that Mr. Sander's request has been made timely and that the Jefferson County SPD office is to appoint Mr. Sanders with new counsel.
The Court does not hold the Initial Appearance for case 15CM251 at this time.
ADA Hall requests that bond be set in case 15CM251; further requests a 940.47 provision
The Court indicates to parties that it will set bond at this time and schedule an expedited Adjourned Initial Appearance so that the remainder of the Initial Appearance occur and will address the request for 940.47 provision at that time

The Court requires $5000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--No Contact with Kelly Lueck
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 10:12am

Case called at 1:28 pm [sf]
Defendant Noah M. Sanders in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney De La Rosa advises that the Defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Address and DOB information verified by the Court.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No contact with Kelly Lueck
-No presence at residence, work or any place Kelly Lueck may temporarily reside with exception that the defendant may return to 404 S. 8th St. Watertown, WI within 72 hours of release from jail as long as he is accompanied by law enforcement

Recess: 1:32 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 7/15/15 at 11:00 am
Status: 8/4/15 at 9:30 am
